name: Courtyard by Marriott Santa Barbara Goleta

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my night here in Feb. The hotel has only been open for 6 months, so everything is new, clean and fresh. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful. Loved having a courtyard room that opened onto a putting green and fire pit. It even had a sliding glass door so I could get fresh air. This hotel is close to UCSB and the beach.
reviews.title: Brand New and Sparkling Clean

reviews.text: Really quite enjoyable. Nothing fancy but big clean room, good working tv and nice bed. Would have given it 5 out of 5 if the shower was a bit more accessible rather than too low in bath tub.
reviews.title: Very much worth the money
Great hotel, nicely locate to Santa Barbara
reviews.text: However, all in all, really good value for money. Would certainly return there!

Great location to Santa Barbara! Staff was very nice, hotel very clean. We only stayed a day, but will come back here again. Utilized the fitness center and staff helped with dinner recommendations. Located right off the highway, would suggest requesting courtyard side room for better view.
reviews.title: Great new hotel for business travellers

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two weeks whilst visiting Goleta on business. Usually I stay at the Harbour View, but on this occasion I wanted to be closer to the office on South Los Carneros. It is very close to the airport and they have an airport shuttle, but you may need to call the hotel from the airport to arrange a pick up as their vehicle wasn't there when my flight came in and I didn't have their number to hand.
reviews.title: Friendly and new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The amenities are very wonderful, including the spacious gym with brand new equipment. The hotel is centrally located and is in walking distance to a shopping mall and several nice restaurants, including several that the front desk staff recommended (gave us a discount card). The staff was friendly and seemed genuinely concerned how we were enjoying our stay, which is a huge plus.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with wonderful service

reviews.text: If I were to ding them on anything it would be how the room doors slam shut. They make a bit too much noise and you can hear neighboring rooms at times.
reviews.title: New and Clean

reviews.text: Had a nice overnight business stay. The hotel is very new and reasonably nice. The elevators are remarkably slow for a two story building and the lobby bistro is a bit expensive for travelling on your own dime. Conveniently located near the airport. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Nice brand new Marriott near Santa Barbara
New & clean, however...
reviews.text: Like I said in my title it is brand new! We had reservations within hours of its opening. We received a welcome gift in celebration of its opening which was a fun surprise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, up to date, and roomy. No breath taking views but that's ok since we were away from the room most of the time. The staff was friendly and quick to provide any services we needed and answer our questions/concerns.
reviews.title: A nice, newer hotel closer to UC Santa Barbara

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night during a college visit to UC Santa Barbara. It's only about 5 minute drive from hotel to the college. Lots of restaurants and stores in the area. The room was clean, and quiet (my pet peeve... I don't want to hear neighbors). Nice bed and linens. Comfortable. Would stay here again without hesitation. Large room and bath.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our go to place when we visit Santa Barbara and Goleta. We are "Marriott" lovers and try to stay at Marriott when ever we can. It is a new hotel and very nice. Out by the pool they have a wonderful place to sit and have drinks around a fire pit. Although it is always a bit to cold to use the pool, the pool area is very nice. Rooms have small frig and beds are comfy. Very pretty lobby and area to eat in with a little bistro area if you will for breakfast and a happy hour. I think you will be pleased to stay here. Hide a bed in room with King bed but with 2 kids it might be a little tight. We were just a couple.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Goleta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I flew in for a wine pick-up party, and this hotel was right next to the airport so it was very convenient. It is as nice as any other Courtyard by Marriott. Didn't spend much time in the hotel, but I'd definitely stay here again - mostly because it was so conveniently located. We were also able to go for a run along the beach from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very close to Airport and Beach
A New Courtyard With Pleasant Innovations
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly—both probably helped by the fact that the property is new—but I was most pleased by ways that the Courtyard brand seems to be trying to make life easier and pleasant for guests. The shower was a wide stall (with a door, not a curtain); the door keys worked by waving them in front of the lock (instead of inserting or swiping); the lobby had double-high ceilings; the computers in the lobby were free to use (including to print); there was even a putting green in the courtyard area. I could do without the TV always being on in the lobby, but I'm not really a TV person. Other than that, I had no complaints. (I will say that the five-circle rating is relative to hotels of this level.) I also liked that the hotel was a couple blocks from Hwy. 101 (and not right on it), and you could walk to the big shopping center, home to various restaurants—many not that notable, but still, within walking distance.

Overpriced rooms and non personal service. More like a motel feel but charging prices like a higher end Marriott. Will not return here again and I travel twice a month to Santa Barbara for business. I was on hold for more than ten minutes so I just hung up.
reviews.title: Noisy doors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over veteran's day weekend. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again when visiting the Santa Barbara area. That said, like all hotels, this one had pluses and minuses.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: The Pluses
reviews.title: Brand new clean hotel.

reviews.text: - Our room (junior suite with king bed) was a step up from most Marriott Courtyard's. Very spacious, with a sitting area somewhat set off from the bed (but not a true suite), and two television sets. The room also had a microwave and a refrigerator. I have to agree with the previous poster about the pillows - unlike most courtyards, this hotel had nice, full sized pillows that were very comfortable. The bathroom was large with a huge shower with incredible water pressure from the large shower head. Loved the fact that they provided a real hair dryer, not those silly mini-hairdryers stuck to the wall.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel Until The Ants Showed Up

reviews.text: - the lobby of this hotel is very nice for a courtyard - it looks more like a resort lobby than a courtyard. There is a courtyard bistro in the restaurant, but breakfast is not included in the room price.
reviews.title: One of the best Marriott Courtyards

reviews.text: - the courtyard of this hotel was truly beautiful! It has lovely landscaping, considering it has only been open a few months, with two fire pits that are lit every night (and, a pool as well). Wonderful cushioned furniture - even a small minature putting green. Very nice.
reviews.title: Great new hotel
